title: Is there a way to track time spent on a certain application on my computer? - Quora

response.answer_text: Hi there!)There is a huge number of time tracking and management services, so it is hard to say which is the best. All of them are great and have as similar as unique features. But I highly recommend to try DueFocus — Your time tracking & management assistant. It saves your tracked time which can be observed on Dashboard and exported as report in tables. Also you can manage your team, projects and tasks, monitoring activities, used applications and productivity for yourself or each employee of your team. It has its own native desktop application. No matter what OS you have. Application is available for Mac OS, Ubuntu and Windows.  As alternative, DueFocus has own Chrome Extension to track time in browser without installation of desktop app.  DueFocus can be integrated with more than 25 tracking systems, such as Jira, Trello, Teamwork, GitHub, GitLab and others. Your tracking system can be integrated to Duefocus by API token, login/password or by OAuth method. If you don’t need it, you can use integrated DueFocus tracker for working on your tasks.  In this easy-to-use application you can: Create your tasks inside applicationTrack time to the issues and report with commentsMonitoring timesheets, used applications and visited web pagesAnalyze your productivity and performance (Work, Communication, Learning, Entertainment, Other);Creating screenshots of your activity (optionally) and save to Dropbox or Google Drive;Export your report data to CSV tables;Create 5 teams for 20 users in every teamMonitoring activities of your team (optionally).Create invoicesSuch tracking systems as Trello, Github, Gitlab, Asana, Mantis etc. have no time tracking feature. But don’t worry, all your worked time and activity will be saved in web application. When you need to analyze the work of your team - use Team Pulse feature. It displays all activities of your team in real-time mode. You are up to create 5 teams which may include 20 teammates in every of them. Also you may customize projects settings, for example, screenshot frequency, idle detection, max daily working time and others.  I hope my answer was helpful for you)

There are several time tracking platforms out there that offer robust time tracking solutions. Hubstaff allows you to track time spent for project, budget and billing purposes but perhaps its best feature is that the time tracking feature provides info on time spent on each application, which application and can take up to 1x, 2x, 3x screenshots every 10 minutes(which can also be disabled). There is also a productivity tracker which tracks how active you are by keystroke. It’s sort of a gamified way to motivate you to work. It will report productivity percentages and where the numbers are at compared to last week. Hubstaff app is device agnostic meaning you can use it on desktop, mobile or tablet across different operating systems and has many integrations making it fun and easy to track time. Another top time tracking app is ATracker. ATracker is great because it can work as a time tracker but also creates reports so you can see where time is spent the most. It’s an easy and elegant set-up that is user friendly. You can check out more of the best time tracking apps of 2018 here. Good luck and I hope this helps!
